Text.Text: Well met, stranger.  I am the Lady Elytharra, wife of Lord Ulbrec.  Are you one of the recent arrivals from Luskan?
You have returned - it is good to see you are well.  Is there something I may help you with?
My husband will be pleased to hear of your offer.  The recent troubles besetting Targos have been weighing on him greatly.

Very little - we have repelled several goblin raiding parties in the past month.  My husband has ordered the construction of a palisade around the town and alerted the people of Targos of a possible attack.  We fear the attack at the docks is but the first of many.
Goblinoids have occupied the town of Bremen, and now their scouts have been sighted near Targos.  We fear that the attack at the docks was another test, and expect another attack soon.
Thanks to your efforts we have driven the goblin horde back, but I fear we have been granted only a temporary reprieve.  My husband would know more.  You should speak with him.

My husband warned the council of the threat, but his words fell on deaf ears.  He has petitioned Luskan and Neverwinter for aid, but Luskan has given no answer, and the Neverwinter forces are many weeks away.  I fear we are on our own.
My magic has been of little help in determining the location of their forces.  Ever since our diviner, Valin, took sick, we are in need of scouts of our own.
You should speak to my husband.  He would be pleased to hear of your gifts and how they might aid Targos.
I have studied the art of Enchantment, but I have not drawn upon my powers for some time.  Most of my efforts have been spent deciphering and transcribing scrolls I have gathered in the region.
If you have come to aid Targos, I would be pleased to pass along what arcane knowledge I can.  Another practitioner of the art would strengthen Targos' defenses greatly.

Yes, my husband Ulbrec.  He once served as the military commander of Neverwinter... that is where we met.  Not long after his retirement, we moved here, to Targos, where he took a seat on the Ten-Towns council.
Perhaps... let me take a closer look.
How curious... the potion is only water - and, as you noted, the enchantment stems from the bottle itself.  It has been touched by the spirits... 'ghost-touched,' as it is sometimes called.
The bottle can hold the essence of the ethereal plane inside, the substance of ghosts and spirits.
Indeed.  A curious thing, though you may find you have little practical use for it.
In truth, I have no idea.  It would depend on the enchanter.  The bottle would have much greater worth if it held some of the ethereal plane within it.
Enchantments carried by the ethereal realm can be quite potent.  A ghost-touched item might be made from even the smallest trace of a spirit's essence.
Why, yes, it could, but... ah, I see where your question leads!  Are you thinking of the haunting of the Weeping Widow?
Little except what Cahl-Hyred, the innkeeper, has told me.  The ghost of a woman is said to haunt the upper stories of the inn at night, waiting for her husband's return.

I believe he is said to have sailed out onto the lake many years ago and never returned.  Consumed by grief, the woman hurled herself from the upper story of the inn and died upon the rocks below... a sad tale.
If you intend to coax a tear from the spirit, you will have to find some means of setting her heart to rest first - otherwise, dealing with her may prove difficult.
It was my pleasure.  Should you come across any more such items in your travels, bring them to me, and I will help you discern their nature.  I find such arcane works fascinating.
I am sorry, but I have no time to speak with you now - the horde is at Targos' walls, and I must assist my husband.
Thank you for your bravery in Targos' defense.  I fear we will need to call upon your courage again before the season is through.
So you were able to set the spirit to rest, then?  This is welcome news, indeed.  It would be my pleasure to help you - may I see the tear you have brought?

Indeed... it depends on what you wish to do with it.  If you want to part with it, I can offer you five hundred gold for it, or if you wish, I may use it to enchant a small blade for you - a dagger perhaps.
The dagger would carry some of the magic of the ethereal plane - and some of the essence of the spirit as well.  There is some unpredictability in such matters, unfortunately.
I'm afraid five hundred is all I can offer.  If you wish, I could enchant a dagger with the tear, and you might be able to sell the dagger to someone else for more.
You are correct, of course.  As a reward for laying that woman's soul to rest, I would be willing to add a sum of my own on top of the base price - would seven hundred gold be agreeable to you?
Here you are.  Thank you, and thank you for freeing that poor woman's spirit.  She must have been suffering greatly.
Of course - you may find him in the main antechamber.  Please, do not let me delay you any longer.
Let me see it.  Hmmm.  It looks like a spell that was miscast... a teleportation spell, perhaps.  Except...
...that this scroll is one of a pair.  It seems that it can be used to teleport a group to someone holding the other scroll, provided the wielder knows something of spellcraft.
It seems we have a serpent within the walls of Targos, and this serpent must be dealt with.  Keep an eye out - if the traitor sees you have this scroll, he or she may try to take it back from you.
Valin Geldencross is a diviner from Bryn Shander who had traveled here with a caravan.  When the goblin attacks began, he offered to help us locate their main camp so we could mount a counterattack.
Unfortunately, he has taken ill.  The priests at the Temple Pavilion are attempting to heal him, but they have many wounded there already.  I fear Valin may be lost to us.
It is doubtful.  Without knowing the cause of his ailment, even the spells of the priests will prove useless.
You will find the Temple Pavilion along the northern wall, just west of the Wind Gate that leads to the Palisade outside of town.

When the rumors spread through town that a drow walked the streets, I did not believe it, but now I see the rumors were true.  You are one of the mercenaries from Luskan, are you not?  It is an... unusual profession for a drow.
I see.  I fear you will find trust hard to come by in Targos, but once you have earned it, you will find the people of Targos to be fierce in your defense.
If you have truly come to stand with Targos, then I suggest you act like it.  I warn you - if you bring harm to anyone in Targos, I will see to it you answer for it.
Now.  What brings you here?

Phaen attacked you?  So he was behind this betrayal, then.  Targos might have fallen when the goblins attacked the docks... had you not been there to stop them.  You have my thanks, and the thanks of my husband.
Please, take these as payment for your service.  I feel, now more than ever, that as long as you stand in Targos' defense, the goblins shall be turned back and the town saved.
Very well, I shall see it done.  Thank you again for all you have done.
I had heard something of that practice, but the sickness did come upon him suddenly.
I had thought that as well, but if it was true, I would think he would have put the instructions somewhere where they could be found.
What do you mean?
Do you think that traitor, Phaen, may have caused Valin's illness somehow?
Do you think that doppleganger in the Temple Pavilion may have caused Valin's illness somehow?
Do you think that traitor, Phaen, or that doppleganger you fought in the Temple Pavilion may have caused Valin's illness somehow?
If that's the case, then it seems we must find out the cause behind Valin's illness.  Targos may depend upon it.
That is welcome news indeed.  Was he able to tell you what happened?
I had not thought goblin shamans - or sorcerers - could have erected such a barrier, especially for such a sizable goblin force.  That is ill news, indeed.
In any event, Targos is again in your debt.
Please, take these as payment for your service.  It is the least I can offer for saving Valin.
Phaen attacked you?  So he was behind this betrayal, then.  Targos might have fallen when the goblins attacked the docks... had you not been there to stop them.
This is serious indeed - it seems we shall have to be on our guard both within and without.  You have my thanks, and the thanks of my husband.
Any help you could offer would be greatly appreciated.  If you can find a way to help Valin, Targos will be in your debt.
We are - but we are looking for Lord Ulbrec.  There are goblins attacking the docks, and we need to assemble the Targos Guard to repel them.
Indeed.  We have come to offer our services to the lord of Targos.
I have a scroll here that I took from one of the goblin sappers.  Could you identify it for me?
Can you tell me what this brimstone scroll might have been used for?
When Phaen caught sight of the brimstone scroll in our possession, he attacked us.  It seems he was behind the attack on the Docks.
When Phaen caught sight of the brimstone scroll in our possession, he attacked us.  It seems he was behind the attack on the Docks.
We were able to help Valin.  He's been cured and has regained consciousness.
I have a potion here from Cahl-Hyred that he wishes to have identified.
I am... I was wondering if you could tell me what this ghost-touched bottle might be used for.
We have obtained a tear from the ghost that haunts the Weeping Widow and were wondering if you could make use of it.
You wear the trappings of an enchantress.  Do you have any magic we might purchase from you?
Do you have any magic we might purchase from you?
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
A force of goblins is attacking the docks.  Could you tell us where we might find Lord Ulbrec?
We have come to offer our services... and swords... to Lord Ulbrec.
I have a scroll here that I took from one of the goblin sappers.  Could you identify it for me?
Can you tell me what this brimstone scroll might have been used for?

Your diviner took ill?  What happened?
We encountered Valin already - we were able to help him regain consciousness.
Your magic?
If you are in need of scouts, then my wilderness skills may be of some use to you.
If you are in need of scouts, then my wilderness skills may be of some use to you.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
You said your diviner took ill?  What happened?
We encountered your diviner, Valin, already - we were able to help him regain consciousness.
You spoke before of your magic - are you a mage?
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
Do you have any scrolls or magic you might be willing to part with?
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
Uh... sure... the defense of Targos and all that.  What kind of magic do you have?
My weapons and my skills shall be employed in Targos' name.  I would be grateful for any help you can provide.
Perhaps I shall take you up on your offer at another time.
I see.  Can you tell us anything of these troubles?
I see.  Can you tell us anything of these troubles?
I have a scroll here that I took from one of the goblin sappers.  Could you identify it for me?
Can you tell me what this brimstone scroll might have been used for?

I was wondering if you could tell me what this ghost-touched bottle might be used for.
We have obtained a tear from the ghost that haunts the Weeping Widow and were wondering if you could make use of it.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
Here you are.
What do you mean?
I've heard of such enchantments.  Weapons that are ghost-touched are said to be able to harm wraiths and other spirits.
What would such a bottle be used for?
What would such a bottle be used for?
Why is that?
Would the tears of a ghost serve?
Would the tears of a ghost serve?
Hmm.  Thank you for your help, Elytharra.
I had thought about it... can you tell me anything about the spirit that haunts the inn?
Well, I had been thinking about it, had we not driven her off already.  In any event, thank you for looking at the bottle for us.
Do you think it might be possible to obtain a tear from her?
Hmmm. Thank you for your help, Elytharra.
Can you tell us anything of the recent troubles plaguing Targos?
Can you tell us anything of the recent troubles plaguing Targos?
I have a scroll here that I took from one of the goblin sappers.  Could you identify it for me?
Can you tell me what this brimstone scroll might have been used for?
When Phaen caught sight of the brimstone scroll in our possession, he attacked us.  It seems he was behind the attack on the Docks.
When Phaen caught sight of the brimstone scroll in our possession, he attacked us.  It seems he was behind the attack on the Docks.
Do you have any magic items we might purchase from you?
Thank you for your time.  Farewell.
I shall go to the Palisade and see what help I can offer, then.
We have come to offer our services... and swords... to Lord Ulbrec.
I have a scroll here that I took from one of the goblin sappers.  Could you identify it for me?
Can you tell me what this brimstone scroll might have been used for?
When Phaen caught sight of the brimstone scroll in our possession, he attacked us.  It seems he was behind the attack on the Docks.
When Phaen caught sight of the brimstone scroll in our possession, he attacked us.  It seems he was behind the attack on the Docks.
We were able to help Valin.  He's been cured and has regained consciousness.
I have a potion here from Cahl-Hyred that he wishes to have identified.
I was wondering if you could tell me what this ghost-touched bottle might be used for.
We have obtained a tear from the ghost that haunts the Weeping Widow and were wondering if you could make use of it.
You wear the trappings of an enchantress.  Do you have any magic we might purchase from you?
Do you have any magic we might purchase from you?
It was my pleasure.  Farewell.
Here you are.  What can be made of it?
Five hundred gold pieces for the tear sounds fair to me.
I'd be willing to sell the tear, but setting the poor woman's soul to rest was no easy task.  Is there any way you could offer more?
I'd be willing to sell the tear, but setting the poor woman's soul to rest was no easy task.  Is there any way you could offer more?
I'll take the dagger.  A magic weapon could prove useful.
I'll take the dagger.  A magic weapon could prove useful.
No, five hundred gold pieces for the tear sounds fair to me.
Hmm. I'll take the dagger, then.
Hmm. I'll take the dagger, then.
That sounds fair to me.  The tear is yours.
Actually, I'll take the dagger instead.
Actually, I'll take the dagger instead.
Before I go, do you have any magic we might purchase from you?
Before I go, do you have any magic we might purchase from you?
It was my pleasure.  Farewell, Lady Elytharra.
Well, suffering is the lifeblood of Faerun.  Farewell.
We will seek him in the antechamber, then.  Farewell.
Except?
That would explain why Phaen attacked us when he saw the scroll, then.  He must have been behind the attack.
That would explain why Phaen attacked us when he saw the scroll, then.  He must have been behind the attack.
Which means that some wizard teleported the goblins into the cave beneath the docks.
We'll see if we can track this traitor down, then.  Farewell.
Is there anything we could do to help him?
We've seen him in the Pavilion.  Is there anything we could do to help him?
You spoke before of your magic - are you a mage?
I see.  I must take my leave.  Farewell.
If he's a diviner, there's a chance he knew what was going to happen.  He may have arranged a way to diagnose or cure himself before he was stricken ill.
Most Northern diviners are known to begin their day by performing an augury over their morning meal.  It's surprising he wouldn't have seen his sickness coming - unless it happened suddenly.
Where is the Temple Pavilion?  Perhaps I could see if I could help him.
You spoke before of your magic - are you a mage?
I see.  I must take my leave.  Farewell.
You spoke before of your magic - are you a mage?
I will see if I can help him, then.  Farewell.
Drow are known to make and change allegiances for profit.  My occupation as a mercenary should not surprise you.
My reasons for being here are my own.  Know that I stand with Targos - and it is all you need to know.
Speaking to you sickens me, *darthiir.*  Do not presume to question me.
A force of goblins is attacking the docks.  Could you tell us where we might find Lord Ulbrec?
We have come to offer our services... and swords... to Lord Ulbrec.
I have a scroll here that I took from one of the goblin sappers.  Could you identify it for me?
Can you tell me what this brimstone scroll might have been used for?

I was wondering if you could tell me what this ghost-touched bottle might be used for.
We have obtained a tear from the ghost that haunts the Weeping Widow and were wondering if you could make use of it.

Do you have any magic we might purchase from you?
Not at this time.  Farewell.
It was our pleasure.  Though I think Phaen thought us to be easy victims.
It was our pleasure.  Though I think Phaen thought us to be easy victims.
It was our pleasure.  Though I think Phaen thought us to be easy victims.
It was our pleasure.  Though I think Phaen thought us to be easy victims.
It was our pleasure.  Though I think Phaen thought us to be easy victims.
The thanks of you and your husband should be worth their weight in gold.
The thanks of you and your husband should be worth their weight in gold.
The thanks of you and your husband should be worth their weight in gold.
The tenets of my faith preclude me from accepting this much wealth.  Please keep your gold and see to it that it find its way to others in greater need than I.
The tenets of my order preclude the acceptance of this much wealth.  Please keep your gold and see to it that it find its way to others in greater need than I.
Thank you... I was wondering if you might help me with another matter.  I have a potion here from Cahl-Hyred that he wishes to have identified.
Thank you... I was wondering if you might help me with another matter.  I was wondering if you could tell me what this ghost-touched bottle might be used for.
Thank you... I was wondering if you might help me with another matter.  We have obtained a tear from the ghost that haunts the Weeping Widow and were wondering if you could make use of it.
I hope so.  Before I leave, do you have any magic we might purchase from you?
We will do what we can to keep Targos safe.  Farewell.
I have a potion here from Cahl-Hyred that he wishes to have identified.
I was wondering if you could tell me what this ghost-touched bottle might be used for.
We have obtained a tear from the ghost that haunts the Weeping Widow and were wondering if you could make use of it.
Before I leave, do you have any magic we might purchase from you?
We will do what we can to keep Targos safe.  Farewell.
It's possible Valin knew what was going to happen, and left instructions on what to do once he came down with the illness.
I don't mean to chase ghosts, but it's possible that there is some reason that Valin did not want them in a place where they could be easily found.
If he came down with this sickness right before his attempt to divine the location of the goblin fortress, then it's likely there's a darker agent at work behind his illness.
If he came down with this sickness right before his attempt to divine the location of the goblin fortress, then it's likely there's a darker agent at work behind his illness.

It's possible, though I think Phaen would have bragged about it before he tried to kill us.  Where is the Temple Pavilion?  Perhaps I should examine Valin and see what I can discover.
You spoke before of your magic - are you a mage?
I see.  I must take my leave.  Farewell.
It's possible, though I think "Garradun" would have bragged about it before he tried to kill us.  Perhaps I should examine Valin and see what I can discover.
You spoke before of your magic - are you a mage?
I see.  I must take my leave.  Farewell.
It's possible, though I think Phaen or "Garradun" would have bragged about it before they tried to kill us.  Perhaps I should examine Valin and see what I can discover.
You spoke before of your magic - are you a mage?
I see.  I must take my leave.  Farewell.
Where is the Temple Pavilion?  Perhaps I could see if I could help him.
You spoke before of your magic - are you a mage?
I see.  I must take my leave.  Farewell.
He had attempted to use his Sight to find the goblin fortress, but some powerful magic blocked his vision and prevented him from awakening.
I'm just glad that Valin is well.  In time, he should make a full recovery.
I'm just glad that Valin is well.  In time, he should make a full recovery.
I'm just glad that Valin is well.  In time, he should make a full recovery.

Well, debts are meant to be settled.
Well, debts are meant to be settled.
Well, debts are meant to be settled.
The tenets of my faith preclude me from accepting this much wealth.  Please keep your gold and see to it that it find its way to others in greater need than I.
The tenets of my order preclude the acceptance of this much wealth.  Please keep your gold and see to it that it find its way to others in greater need than I.
Thank you.  By the way, I have a potion here from Cahl-Hyred that he wishes to have identified.
Thank you.  By the way, I was wondering if you could tell me what this ghost-touched bottle might be used for.
We have obtained a tear from the ghost that haunts the Weeping Widow and were wondering if you could make use of it.
I hope so.  Before I leave, do you have any magic we might purchase from you?
We will do what we can to keep Targos safe.  Farewell.
I think the matter goes beyond Phaen.  He mentioned something about serving a master named Harshom, and that Harshom served someone else - Phaen sounds like a link in a very long chain.
It was our pleasure.  Though I think Phaen thought us to be easy victims.
It was our pleasure.  Though I think Phaen thought us to be easy victims.
It was our pleasure.  Though I think Phaen thought us to be easy victims.
It was our pleasure.  Though I think Phaen thought us to be easy victims.

The thanks of you and your husband should be worth their weight in gold.
The thanks of you and your husband should be worth their weight in gold.

I will see what I can do, then.  Farewell.
